jd:
POSITION OVERVIEW:
We are seeking a highly motivated Health and Safety Specialist with extensive experience in developing, implementing and maintaining a broad range of safety and environmental programs. In this position, you will be joining our Health and Safety Services team within the Environment, Safety, and Health Division. Members of this team support Construction Safety, site safety services and industrial hygiene function critical to SLAC’s scientific research and operational mission.
In addition to core duties, specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Support construction projects (field observations and project planning documentation and specifications) to ensure that they meet requirements; work with stakeholders to find the best solution to safety problems while enabling the team to meet the project schedule and budget.
Develop and deliver safety training for programs that they manage. Examples may include: fall protection, confined space, electrical safety, etc.
Manage one or more specific ES&H; topic programs this includes administering, assessing, and improving programs, and serving as a subject matter expert in support of operations at the Laboratory. Possible programs may include general construction safety, hoisting & rigging, powered industrial trucks, contractor safety, permitting, etc.
Develop and conduct training; identify, assessments, and monitor workplace hazards and hazard mitigations; support the investigation of incidents; providing technical advice and interpretation of regulations.
Effectively interface and collaborate with all levels of staff including technicians, principal investigators, and operational support teams and subcontractors.
Ensure activities are preplanned for safety through scope review, preconstruction meetings, site specific safety plan and JSA review, etc.
Ensure SLAC submittal requirements are met per ISEMS (i.e.: Critical Lift Plans, Fall Prevention Plans, Confined Space Entry Plan, etc.)
Ensure compliance to SLAC requirements including but not limited to: training and equipment inspection and other documentation
Perform daily inspections
JOB PURPOSE:
Under limited supervision, perform moderately complex technical work in a wide range of environmental, health, and safety disciplines to ensure a safe work environment and to achieve compliance with SLAC’s Environment, Safety and Health Program and governmental regulatory requirements.
CORE DUTIES*:
Develop, implement, and maintain programs, systems, and procedures necessary to ensure the overall safety and health of employees and the community. May develop and conduct employee and student training, emergency preparedness activities, and/or assurance and accreditation programs.
Identify, assess, and monitor workplace hazards (including but not limited to, chemical, physical, biological, and radiological) that could be present in the work area; remediate hazards, and/or recommend improvements to minimize hazard potential.
Investigate accidents, incidents, injuries, and complaints concerning potential hazards or unsafe conditions in the work place.
Recommend improvements in processes, design, procedures, and operating equipment to minimize hazard potential.
Provide technical advice and interpretation of various government regulations and SLAC policies; maintain working knowledge of specific government regulations.
May act as a lead or technical expert, and provide direction to less experienced personnel working on health/safety programs.
- Other duties may also be assigned
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree and three years progressively responsible experience in occupational safety and health, construction safety, emergency response/management, environmental science, and/or allied/scientific field, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
A background in one or more of the following is strongly preferred:
General construction safety involving hoisting & rigging, powered industrial trucks, hazardous mat/waste management, contractor safety, permitting, indoor air quality investigations, etc. Construction safety experience.
Industrial hygiene, electrical safety, waste management, environmental sustainability, etc.
Experience in an academic or laboratory research environment strongly preferred.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Working knowledge of construction safety principles, techniques and methods.
Practical knowledge of Cal/OSHA laws, regulations and policies.
Capable of identifying known potential exposures and recommending corrective action
Demonstrated ability to conduct effective health and safety surveys, quantitative and qualitative exposure/risk assessments, and data analyses; ability to provide recommendations for exposure/risk control.
Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with diverse audiences; ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely.
Ability to maintain current knowledge of and interpret specific government agency requirements (statutes, regulations, licenses, and permits) and university policies.
Working knowledge of the scientific and technical aspects of various regulatory requirements and potential impact on assigned work area(s).
Successfully interface and collaborate with all levels of staff including technicians, principal investigators and operational support teams.
Computer skills and familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite.
Certifications and Licenses:
Must have OSHA 30Hr construction certification within the last 3 years.
Professional certifications in (e.g., Associate Safety Professional (ASP), Construction Health and Safety Technician (CHST), Certified Safety Professional (CSP), etc.), strongly preferred but not required.
SLAC Employee Competencies:
Effective Decisions: Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.
Self-Development: Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing.
Dependability: Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes.
Initiative: Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward.
Adaptability: Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes.
Communication: Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages.
Relationships: Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.
Job-Specific Competencies
Manages Ambiguity: Operates effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
Manages Conflict: Handles conflict situations effectively, with minimum noise.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
Frequently stand, sit, and perform desk based computer tasks, conduct walk-throughs and perform inspections,
Occasionally use a telephone, write by hand.
Occasionally kneel, crawl, climb ladders, reach/work above shoulder, twist/bend/stoop/squat, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, grasp forcefully, sort and file paperwork or parts, operate foot and/or hand controls, carry, push, and pull objects that weigh 40 pounds or more.
Ability to maintain a valid non-commercial California Driver's license.
- Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Must wear personal protective equipment as defined/required by job assignments.
May rarely be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, allergens/biohazards/chemicals /asbestos, or heavy metals
May rarely work in confined spaces or at heights 10 feet.
WORK STANDARDS:
When conducting university business, must comply with the California Vehicle Code and Stanford University driving requirements.
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.

jd:
As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Perks & Benefits
Unlimited Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Days & Holidays
100% Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan
Life Insurance, 401k, Flexible Spending Accounts, Commuter Benefits & More
Catered Lunches & Well-stocked Kitchens
Food Truck Fridays
Yoga & Wellness Activities
Happy Hours
Company Retreats
Pet Friendly

ABOUT THE ROLE
Jam City is on the hunt for the best and brightest User Acquisition Specialist in Los Angeles to work on our next generation of top-10 cross-platform games. We're looking for a talented User Acquisition Specialist with a passion for marketing, user acquisition and games. This role will support the marketing team’s efforts on player acquisition campaigns, coordinate with marketing designers to come up with the next eye catching creative, and manage budgets and marketing strategy.
RESPONSIBILITIES
A team player willing to take direction but also exhibit initiative when working independently.
A fast learner, as you will continually be optimizing efforts based on data-driven metrics and ever-developing tech.
Develop an acquisition marketing strategy for Jam City game franchisesManage and optimize a large, multi-million-dollar acquisition marketing budget.
Own and present key performance metrics including ROAS and internal.
KPI targets on acquisition marketing to senior leadershipMonitor, measure and report on campaign performance, budgeting, and conduct ad hoc analysis to refine strategies.
Work closely with UA managers and other teams to execute coordinated strategic campaigns.
Motivated to identify missing opportunities and take them on as your own.
Aptitude to work outside of your comfort zone and get things done quickly.
Passion/knowledge for games.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree. Preferably one in a quantitative discipline.
1+ year experience in business or partnership development or digital marketing.
Strong entry-level or internship experience.
Proficient in excel and power point.
Ability to troubleshoot data issues.
Ridiculously awesome work ethic.
Ability to initiate, develop and maintain partnerships with other mobile and online companies.
Knowledge of mobile advertising campaign setup, optimization, and accounts management.
Ability to vet potential partners as first point of contact for Jam City.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including strong writing and editing skills.
A passion for casual and mobile games!

jd: CRM Administrator ~ Entry Level OpeningBrighton Collectibles, a leading accessory manufacturer and retailer, is recruiting for a dynamic and enthusiastic member to their marketing team! Brighton defines CRM, or Customer Relationship Management, as the strategies, technologies, and practices associated with Brighton's relationship to our customers (consumers, our specialty stores and wholesale retailers) throughout their lifecycle, with the goals of improving on that relationship, assisting in customer retention, and driving sales. Reporting to the CRM Director, the CRM Administrator will deliver ad hoc and ongoing reporting to Executives, District Managers, and stores. The CRM Administrator will also help with the deployment of marketing emails to consumers. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Plans, develops and administers the benefits program administration activities.

Administers various employee benefits programs including group health, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, dental and vision benefits.

Prepares, distributes, and maintains benefits description booklets, annual statements, and certificates.

Educates employees on company benefits and assists, as needed, with enrolling in benefits and making permitted changes.

Conduct benefits orientations and explain benefits self-enrollment system.

Ensures that department page on Company intranet is updated with current content

Process approvals, follow-up, and document all Workday transactions

Process Qualified Medical Support Court Orders

Helps ensure the accuracy of all benefits elections in the system to provide vendors and payroll with accurate eligibility, enrollment and payroll deduction information.

Provide administrative support including data entry, and responding to employee and vendor phone and email inquiries. Assists with annual open enrollment thru testing of the system and conducting employee education sessions.

Remains current on all government regulations involving payroll and benefits, including Fair Labor Standards Act, Americans with Disabilities Act, ERISA, HIPAA, ACA and other statutory regulations.

Compiles and audits periodic and special reports on benefits matters for senior HR management.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree and 2-3 years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience with Workday highly preferred.

Ceridian payroll system experience beneficial.

Strong working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Strong understanding of HRIS systems, and custom queries.

Familiarity with federal and state legislation regarding benefits practices

Able to handle high level of confidentiality regarding employee information & confidential organizational changes.

Excellent planning, time management, communication, decision-making, presentation, organization, and interpersonal skills.

jd:
WHO WE ARE:
Kelton is a strategy consultancy that creates consumer-oriented business solutions based on core human truths. We create brand relevance and resonance for our clients, by taking a creative, thoughtful and rigorous approach to interpreting insights, developing strategies, and designing solutions that deliver on consumer desires. We have a leadership team made up of seasoned research, communications, marketing, and innovation/design professionals; thus there is ample opportunity to learn and grow every day. We are proud of having an entrepreneurial, start-up culture where training is very "hands on" and there's an atmosphere in which teams are tight and colleagues really help each other.

We serve as a strategic partner to a broad array of cross-industry clients including Target, Coca-Cola, Google, Pfizer, Amazon, Harley-Davidson, Verizon, TOMS, and 9 of the 10 largest PR firms in the country. With our consumer insights and research platform, we've built a team that is uniquely positioned to develop solutions for clients that keep their customers at the center of their strategy, marketing, and innovation efforts.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
We have a fantastic opportunity for a motivated, innovative quantitative researcher. If you yearn to learn and grow your research and consulting skills while working with some of the best in the industry, this is the opportunity for you! In this role, we need you to be naturally curious and have a passion for understanding human behavior. A high level of motivation and excellent communication skills are required to manage an incredibly diverse slate of work, clients, and team personalities.

Flexibility to work on multiple projects, a natural aptitude for organization, and deadline-driven deliverable creation are equally important in this fast-paced environment. If you're someone who is able to deliver amidst the dynamic nature of workload and pace inherent in a client service business, we want to meet you!

We're relatively flexible on years of experience (although we desire at least 2 years working in a relevant agency or consulting environment). The right person for this role won't back down from a challenge, and will relish being in a small, entrepreneurial, fast growing environment. You must share our passion and energy for developing creative research solutions for our clients. We want you to begin consulting on day 1, and you should be a savvy, problem-solving marketing and research professional.

This position will partner closely with a diverse set of research and strategy colleagues to grow and build domestic and global client relationships. In this role, we are looking for someone who brings stellar quantitative technical research skills, but that's not enough on its own. We need a self-starter who is comfortable working on all stages of the process, from networking and capabilities discussions to crafting project proposals, questionnaires, story-driven deliverables, and participating in key research activities in order to foster client relationships.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Project management responsibilities are threefold. You must be able to (with limited oversight), effectively manage the following:
Be the first point of contact for clients on projects and maintain comprehensive notes, demonstrating an ability to own client contact for projects of appropriate complexity,
Maintain organization and timelines among the internal team (with the ability and desire to learn how to manage both "up" and "down"),
Manage relationship with external vendors, including managing quality control, approving coding lists and providing clear instructions to vendors.
Manage programming and fielding operations, including survey programming, analysis plan, and banners/tabs.
Assist with report creation, including writing, analysis, chart/table creation in Excel or PowerPoint, Assist or lead writing survey questionnaires, in alignment with key survey writing principles
Test survey links (including testing for spelling, grammar, and logic skips) prior to survey field
Conduct secondary deck research to augment primary research learnings.
Be able to effectively problem solve logistical issues and adjust on the fly.
Proactively identify issues and suggests solutions on how to make projects run more smoothly.
Basic understanding of qualitative research; able to guide the transition/serve as the link from quant to qual.
Manage interns and entry-level staff on a project. Demonstrate a capability to help improve their skills, know what and when to delegate.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

2+ years relevant work experience, social science/research background desired.
Excellent Excel, SPSS, and PowerPoint skills are necessary to be successful in this role
Experience working on both quantitative and integrated qual/quant engagements is preferred.
Strong project management skills including an interest in growing and building strategic consulting skills. Be extremely comfortable talking with clients
Strong attention to detail
Passion for solving big problems for big brands
Bachelor's degree required, Master's degree a plus.

jd:
This position is responsible to ensure the House of Rohl’s merchandising program delivers maximum results and return on investment.The position will work cross functionally with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the merchandising program is capable of being carried out from design through delivery and installation.The position requires an individual that can analyze data, optimize product selection and continuously improve sales via merchandising.

Job Description:

This position is responsible to ensure the House of Rohl’s merchandising program delivers maximum results and return on investment.The position will work cross functionally with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the merchandising program is capable of being carried out from design through delivery and installation.The position requires an individual that can analyze data, optimize product selection and continuously improve sales via merchandising. This person is the main point of contact with GBM for all House of Rohl US and Global ROHL brand Merchandising programs.

Job Responsibilities:
Develops innovative ideas of how to improve the merchandising for the House of Rohl and works to implement the ideas across the organization(s) and third party partners.
Responsible for the development of the Merchandising Program and all Merchandising Collateral.
In conjunction with the House of Rohl Global Brand Marketing. Ensures the proper selection of 3rd party suppliers to deliver maximum results.
Assist Marketing team in the development of needed graphics to be used in merchandising.
Coordinates with the third party installation teams and sales representatives to ensure timely and professional installation that meets or exceeds our merchandising standards.
Supports and ensures the accurate entry of merchandise orders/bids/proposals.
Assists in the development and execution of merchandising standards.
Provides market data (qualitative and quantitative) on the performance of the merchandising program of the House of Rohl and our competitors.
Maintains the merchandising database and all performance metrics.
Works with Product Marketing and Purchasing to ensure appropriate levels of merchandising product/parts inventory.
Works with Director of Operations and 3rd Party Merchandising partner on any custom projects / needs.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of related experience is required. In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree, must possess an Associate’s degree and 6 years of related experience.
Excellent verbal, written and platform communication skills.
Ability to work and drive results cross-functionally.
Project/program management skills.
Creativity in merchandising.

jd:
Job Description:
Gurtin Municipal Bond Management, LLC is a premier investment management firm seeking an entry level Portfolio Manager in our San Diego Office this fall. This position provides a unique opportunity to gain valuable exposure to the municipal asset class; and make a measurable impact in a growing financial services firm with over $14B AUM as of August 31, 2018. In this role, the Associate PM will report directly to the Head of Portfolio Management. We are seeking an analytical, motivated professional to join our fast growing and collaborative team. Supporting our six primary investment strategies, the position offers a worthwhile, career opportunity to perform a vast array of statistical research, from bond modeling and duration calculations to portfolio yield projections. In addition, the Associate will monitor and report portfolio performance, providing in time, the opportunity to make recommendations to improve portfolio performance.
Selected Responsibilities:
Trading of municipal, agency and Treasury bonds for client accounts
Collect market data and conduct analysis to identify investment opportunities
Assisting portfolio managers in day-to-day portfolio management activities
Build and maintain strong relationships with external industry participants
Analyze economic data along with financial and industry trends. Proactively communicate these findings to Analysts and Portfolio Managers
Monitor portfolio performance and statistics (duration, credit quality, yields, etc.) for separately managed accounts and mutual funds
Produce, as necessary, written reports and regular updates for weekly Investment Committee meetings
Trade reconciliation and other operational duties
- Commence work at the crack of dawn - tied to east coast market hours
Requirements/Qualifications:
BA/BS degree is required. Significant coursework in statistics or a related discipline focusing on the practical, quantitative application of statistical or mathematical principles is preferred
- CFA designation or in the completion process - preferred
Strong research skills and the drive to develop investment insight and recommendations from multiple angles
Ability to work independently while working within a collaborative team environment
Possess intellectual curiosity and entrepreneurial spirit, and ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously
Ability to speak and write clearly and concisely to varied audiences
A basic understanding of financial markets is required
Proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint.
Knowledge of Bloomberg a plus
Compensation:: Starting base salary range is commensurate with experience. Bonus is based on performance.
Company Description: With over $14 billion in assets under management as of August 31, 2018, Gurtin Municipal Bond Management is a fast-growing investment management firm committed to making investors and their advisors feel more comfortable with their municipal investments and financial future. Recognized as a “Top Workplace” for the past two years in a row by the San Diego Union-Tribune as well as a “Best Place to Work For Financial Advisors 2018” by Investment News, we offer a unique culture that combines the casual and collaborative work environment of the West Coast with the intensity, sophistication, and professionalism of Wall Street, and are always looking to invest in talented individuals who will excel at Gurtin.

For more information on the firm and the awards please visit our website at www.gurtin.com.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

It is our policy to comply with all applicable state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination in employment based on race, age, color, sex, religion, national origin, or other protected classification. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

jd:
The Yelp for Restaurants team is seeking a creative, data-driven and user obsessed Senior Product Marketing Manager for its consumer-facing restaurant experiences.

In this role, you will work with Product and Marketing leaders to massively grow usage of Yelp’s consumer-facing restaurant products. You will work collaboratively with Product to define the product roadmap and implement strategies to grow Yelp’s diner network. You will create offline and online marketing assets to promote Yelp restaurant products to diners. You will own product positioning, develop strategies to bring new features and products effectively to market, and manage cross-functional launch plans. You will understand market trends and our competitors and partner with Product to improve our positioning and differentiation.

This is a senior level marketing role that requires deep collaboration and leadership across functions, an analytical and results-driven mindset, and a strong interest in connecting Yelp users with their favorite restaurants. This role reports into our Head of Marketing for Restaurants.
Success Metrics:
Growth in diners seated by Yelp
Growth in food orders placed on Yelp
Improvement in diner retention
Key Questions this Role Will Continuously Answer:
Who are our target customers, what are their needs and how can we uniquely solve those needs?
What is our value proposition? How can it be best communicated across all external communication, particularly in-product?
How do we accelerate diner growth at a reasonable cost? What levers are most effective?
Who are our key competitors and how do we win against them?
How do we most effectively bring new products and features to the market?
Key Responsibilities:
Segmentation. Segment diners, their pain points and needs through qualitative and quantitative research
Positioning and messaging. Develop clear product positioning, value propositions, and key messages for Yelp’s consumer-facing restaurant products with input from Product, data insights and competitive analysis. Constantly test and iterate on our messaging, particularly in-product.
Diner marketing strategy & execution. Create and execute a cross-channel strategy to grow Yelp’s diner network, including in-product, online and offline tactics (such as in-restaurant marketing).
Define product roadmap. Build a strategic partnership with Product Management to inform, support and define the product roadmap
In-product marketing. Partner with Product to optimize in-product levers for growth and engagement; lead and support testing of product copy, CTAs and new entry points; lead and coordinate campaigns across all stakeholders.
In-restaurant marketing. Develop collateral and other marketing assets for restaurants to promote Yelp restaurant products to their diners. Constantly measure the impact, optimize and test again.
Product launches. Manage go-to-market strategy for all new product features: create product positioning, define target audience, conduct competitive analysis, develop external communication plan and manage its execution, and track KPIs.
Lead product launch plans ensuring that all teams are prepared for the release. Lead cross-functional meetings to drive alignment, identify dependencies, and resolve roadblocks.
Driving messaging across all external communication channels.
Partner with Restaurant Product Marketing to message diner product launches to restaurants.
Understand our users. Drive quantitative and qualitative customer intelligence and capture user feedback
Market landscape. Understand market trends and competitors and develop marketing strategies to increase our market presence and penetration.
Cross-functional coordination. Collaborate with marketing functions across Yelp including Creative, PR, email marketing, performance marketing, and content marketing.
Qualifications:
At least 5 years professional experience, including at least 3 years working in product marketing
B2C marketing experience, preferably with early stage start-ups
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong interest in helping restaurant owners succeed
A collaborative, team-oriented attitude
Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth company
Entrepreneurial mindset
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

#LI-JL1

jd:
Position: Associate, Planning
Reports To: Supervisor
Industry Experience: 0 – 1year

Job Overview:
The Associate Media Planner will work within a planning team to accomplish marketing and promotional objectives. This is an entry level position. The Associate Media Planner will assist Media Planners and Planning Supervisors in the preparation of budgets, reports, spreadsheets, and media proposals. This person will also resolve bill discrepancies. The Associate Planner is also responsible for expanding his/her knowledge base in preparation for promotion. This growth should be clearly visible within the first year as an Associate Media Planner.

Job Responsibilities:
 Writing budget reports on whether funds were appropriately spent and if the existing budget is at an expected level.
 Writing competitive analysis to get a sense of where the competitors are advertising and how much they are spending.
 Maintain flowcharts/plans
 Developing media delivery analysis
 Developing agency point of views on media opportunities for submission to the client
 Conferring with the client, account team, production and traffic to meet marketing goals and objectives
 Developing media plans that specify which forms of media will be used to effectively reach the target audience
 Studying demographic data and consumer profiles to identify desired target audiences for specific media vehicles, including lifestyles and psychographics
 Performing various calculations to identify the usefulness of different media plans.
 Meeting with sales representatives to obtain information about their products

Job Requirements:
 Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a concentration in advertising, marketing, business administration, and communications
 Although no media planning experience is required an internship with an advertising/media agency is strongly preferred
 Basic Knowledge of Media
 Comfortable working with budgets and numbers
 Excellent verbal and written skills
 Strong quantitative and analytical skills
 Exceptional organizational skills, multi-tasking capabilities and detail oriented
 Computer literate with proficiency in Excel, Word and PowerPoint
 Strong communication and people skills; positive attitude and team player
 Prior Knowledge of Media Tools and Donovan Data Systems is a plus but not required

jd: Part-timeJob Description: Avum is seeking a knowledgeable, resourceful Administrative Assistant/Cost Accountant to support daily office functions and manage financial transactions, payroll, and billing to ensure accurate and timely payments for all corporate accounts. This position requires the ability to learn Avum’s financial procedures, create/update policy documentation, and support pricing efforts for new business proposals/quotes.The candidate should be comfortable working with a diverse team of individuals who work both locally and remotely. The ability to always learn and share knowledge with peers in a fast-paced atmosphere is required to be successful in this dynamic role. Avum provides an exciting, fast-paced environment and rewards dedication and innovation.Candidates must be U.S. Citizens and be able to pass a background investigation.Essential Functions: Management of corporate accounts including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, General Ledger, Asset Management, and Payroll.Develop and plan a strategy for ensuring all transactions occur on time.Assist in annual Financial and DCAA audits as necessary.Create, maintain, and follow sound internal controls for revenue recognition and project accounting procedures.Assist in yearly budget and ongoing to budget, prior reporting periods and/or prior years.Prepare G/L account reconciliations and journal entries, to include recurring monthly entries and inter-company reconciliation with a corporate Avum's expertise is in process streamlining and re-engineering, application design, development and implementation, information assurance, intelligent agent cybersecurity, and large-scale database sustainment in mission-critical and secure environments. Through results-driven, agile collaboration, the company continually researches and deploys secure solutions that exceed customer expectations in meeting or beating customer-allocated budgets and schedules. We aspire to the highest standards of ethical behavior and professional integrity in providing our customers with service that consistently earns us the highest possible performance ratings. jd:
Celerity Consulting Group, Inc. has an opening for an Engineering Consultant in Walnut Creek, CA. This position is ideal for an entry-level Engineer who is looking who start their career in consulting and client-oriented organization.

Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:
Review existing documentation for key information and specifications
Analyze data using appropriate quantitative methods
Assist with Feature Study/Pipeline Feature List (PFL) creation and quality control QC
Conduct basic GIS functions including the preparation of maps or exhibits, querying geodatabases, or extracting data
Prepare and revise drafts to As-Built or Completion Sets using AutoCAD
Review documents and provides mark-ups based on client and project specifications
Assist Lead Engineer or CAD Manager in creating construction documents and reports
Provide and prepare engineering design and calculations, under close supervision of an Engineer or Manager
Maintain up to date tracking logs and all project coordination tools to include project status, challenges, estimated project end date, and project completion

The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field and/or relevant work experience
Ability to read and understand general engineering documents, including drawings and specifications
Experience in Gas and utilities is preferred
Able to work or travel to multiple worksites (Walnut Creek, San Ramon, or San Francisco), per clients’ needs
Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Outlook)
Highly organized, deadline driven, and detail oriented
Flexible, analytical, and willing to tackle challenging work
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in an open environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (able to present technical matters in a clear and concise manner)
Working knowledge of AutoCAD or MicroStation CAD, and graphic information system (GIS) software
Working knowledge of engineering calculations


Physical requirements:

Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time.
The person in this position frequently communicates with staff/clients who have inquiries. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity equipment, such as a mouse, keyboard, scanner, copier, and calculator.

This position is located in Walnut Creek, CA and does not qualify for relocation or visa sponsorship

More about us:
Celerity Consulting Group, Inc. is an information management consulting firm that helps companies, law firms, regulated entities, and public agencies resolve their litigation, compliance, regulatory, and restructuring challenges. Our services and solutions center around helping teams and departments find, collect, process, review, analyze, manage, and report on data and information in a defensible and efficient manner. Founded in 2001, we are a woman-owned business, certified by the California Public Utilities Commission Supplier Clearinghouse. With locations in Los Angeles, Seattle, and the San Francisco Bay Area. Our client base is impressive, serving Fortune 500 companies, several state attorneys general offices, some of the largest utilities in the country, and 14 of the AmLaw 2016 top 25 law firms.
See full details and meet our leadership team on our website: https://www.consultcelerity.com/

Celerity is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veterans’ status or other status protected by applicable law.

jobtitle: HRIS Analyst - Los Angeles Los Angeles, California
jd:
About Us

At Korn Ferry, we grasp every opportunity to surprise others and ourselves by going beyond expectations to deliver a bit extra. We call it exceeding potential. To inspire and excite people, teams, even entire organizations. To bring companies’ strategies to life. To unite boardrooms and workforces. To unlock potential, realize ambitions, and change lives. Together, we are smarter. Together we are stronger. Together, we are more than.

Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people.

Our 7,500 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries. We offer five core solutions.

Organizational Strategy
Assessment and Succession
Talent Acquisition
Leadership Development
Rewards and Benefits

The Role

This position partners with the Global HRIS Leader to run the day-to-day operations of the HRIS department, including data input and validation, running reports, and providing end-user support with a focus on improving processes and leveraging return on technological capabilities. The HRIS Analyst builds project plans, ensures adherence to project schedules, maintains a systems orientation and can work effectively with peers to set priorities and conduct long-term planning.

This position also serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional area and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS analyst also supports SAP HCM upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.Responsible for optimizing SAP HCM system use including maintaining data integrity and security, report development and testing, and report generation.

Also responsible for troubleshooting systems issues and partnering with the required parties to resolve problems, providing end-user support and other data intensive projects and initiatives. Ensures the Organizational Management module is 100% accurate to support inter-dependencies across other systems
Key Accountabilities

Perform day-to-day SAP HCM data requirements, including data entry and verification
Act as a key knowledge expert for SAP HCM environment
Partner with leadership to identify system improvement and value creation opportunities and work with business stakeholders to implement them
Generate reports/queries, including writing and maintaining a variety of reports or queries utilizing available reporting tools
Provide HR analytical reporting and analysis to help drive informed decisions
Assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs
Helps maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.
Assist in the review, testing and implementation of HCM system upgrades and patches.
Perform HCM data audits to include org management and on-going data clean-up
Partner with system users to ensure new processes are adhered to, assisting with communication and clarification of steps/processes
Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions policy changes and/or changes to established policy, ensuring changes are approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation
Conduct training for new system users, including developing user procedures, guidelines and documentation
Other key tasks as assigned

Skills & Experience

Experience and Education Requirements

College degree required, preferably in Business or Human Resources
Minimum of two years’ experience in HRIS Administration required
Project management/coordination experience with demonstrated experience balancing multiple priorities and tasks effectively
Intermediate to advanced level skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
Experience with SAP HCM, SAP forms, and BOBJ are a plus
Exposure or experience in global HRIS preferred
PHR certified preferred
Competencies/Skills

Ability to organize, prioritize and work independently managing multiple deadlines simultaneously and in a calm, professional manner
Demonstrated ability to learn, understand and use new technology, learn new skills, and tackle new challenges
Focus on innovation and streamlining work processes
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately
Strong detail orientation
Highly motivated self-starter with a strong customer service focus and an ability to anticipate problems and identify solutions
Flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities in a sometime ambiguous environment
Responsiveness to internal clients and a willingness to assist with urgent request
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to interact with team members at all levels of the organization
Strong work ethic, integrity, dependable, reliable, committed to quality.
Understanding and demonstrated ability to use qualitative/quantitative measurement and data collection design principles
Engaged in on-going learning, including maintaining awareness of current trends in HR/HRIS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, applying key technologies, and training and documentation

Other

Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/ Veteran. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

jd:
Junior Operations Associate
About the Firm

Aperio Group is a quantitative/index-oriented investment management firm. We specialize in three practice areas: active tax management, factor tilts, and Socially Responsive Indexing/ ESG. With our depth of experience, we design and manage portfolios that reflect a client’s preferred risk profile and values while controlling tax costs and fees.

We recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At Aperio, we work hard and move quickly as a well-coordinated team. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary client service. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, Aperio is the place for you.

 Position Description

We are adding to our staff and are looking for a Junior Operations Associate who is bright, articulate and has a sense of humor. This is an entry level position and an excellent opportunity for someone interested in gaining experience in the Finance Industry. Ideal candidates will have excellent problem-solving skills, a high degree of attention to detail, and excellent organizational skills. This is a great opportunity to work for a growing investment management firm.

Interested candidates must provide a cover letter, résumé, and salary expectations. To submit your application, please visit https://www.aperiogroup.com/contact/information/careers?start=3


Duties and Responsibilities
Download and archive custodial statements for all accounts monthly
Review incoming faxes and mailing daily
Process proxy voting for accounts through manual ballots or online as needed
Respond to various external and internal requests in a timely and professional manner
Work on miscellaneous projects to streamline operations, automate processes, and reduce errors
Participate in projects to enhance the client experience
Effectively document and maintain processes
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills/Experience

BA/BS required
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent problem-solving and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational and multitasking skills
Able to work independently and in a small group environment, a collaborative attitude is a must
Advanced Microsoft Office
A high degree of integrity with the ability to handle confidential matters
Able to work in a fast paced environment
Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

jd:
Talent Acquisition | Powered by LEAPROS
Chipotle Mexican Grill has partnered with LEAPROS™ Workforce Solutions to build a world-class corporate team in beautiful Newport Beach, CA. This is a rare and exciting opportunity to be part of a major brand revitalization and culture transformation that will drive growth and enable long-term success. Don’t miss this opportunity to be part of a world-class team and help shape the future of a well-branded Fortune 500 company.
POSITION TITLE: Analyst, Financial Reporting & Accounting
ABOUT CHIPOTLE
Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically-cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without added colors, flavors or other additives. Chipotle has more than 2,400 restaurants as of March 31, 2018 in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. With more than 70,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices.
CULTIVATING A BETTER WORLD
Food served fast doesn’t have to be a typical fast food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We're changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you'll join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.
THE OPPORTUNITY
The Financial Reporting & Accounting Analyst completes, updates, and maintains complex and routine journal entries for the monthly general ledger close. The Analyst analyzes and interprets status of accounts and communicates results. He/she participates in annual audits, and documents accounting procedures under GAAP and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) requirements. The Analyst prepares both internal and external financial statements accurately and in a timely manner
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Preparing complex and routine journal entries during the monthly general ledger close, reconciling complex balance sheet accounts (e.g. analyzing, gogtracking, determining, and making changes), and presenting, communicating, and/or resolving unusual items
Analyzing and interpreting status of accounts and communicating this information to the appropriate managers and staff
Preparing both external and internal financial statements in an accurate and timely manner
Participating in annual external audit and quarterly reviews; includes working with the accounting team to establish schedules and meeting any related deadlines, supporting conclusions/positions, and providing requested back-up to auditors
Developing and performing internal controls under SOX requirements; maintaining documentation over accounting and financial reporting processes; assisting with SOX compliance and internal audit requests.
Completing XBRL tagging for SEC filings
Performing international accounting, consolidation, and participating in annual statutory audits
Maintaining the policies and procedures manual and accurately maintaining chart of accounts
Preparing other financial and accounting analyses and providing business perspective, support, and financial consultation to Wynkoop departments
Assist or manage accounting work for assigned special projects
Identifying areas of opportunity throughout accounting processes and the business, and proactively acting on those opportunities by suggesting and/ or making changes
Perform occasional technical accounting research
Working efficiently by utilizing available resources to manage multiple deadlines or projects at the same time
Sharing knowledge with others about accounting and financial reporting
Other duties as required to meet the needs of the business
This job description is designed to contain a condensed overview of the skills and experience applicable to the successful performance of this role
WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE TABLE
To perform this job successfully, you’ll need to be able to perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Possess a B.A./B.S./Masters in Accounting, with at least three (3) years of experience in public accounting and/or industry
Be a licensed CPA or working towards CPA eligibility
Have experience accounting for a variety of issues in compliance with U.S. GAAP
Have a positive attitude
Love collaborating and working in a team
Possess excellent analytical, quantitative, written, and verbal communication skills
Be able to effectively manage priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment
Be able to manage financial data in a confidential and professional manner
At LEAPROS™, we are committed to our core values and guiding ethical principles, to conducting business in a non-discriminatory manner, and to operating in strict compliance with applicable federal and state laws pertaining to Equal Employment Opportunity. This commitment enhances our ability to conduct business with the highest level of integrity, solidifying our position as the most trusted workforce solutions partner. To learn more about LEAPROS™ or to speak with one of our recruitment partners, call 866-920-LEAP or visit our website at www.leapros.com.

jd:
Pixelberry Studios, a division of Nexon, is the creator of the hit game "Choices: Stories You Play". Our team has been around since 2011, and is 3-for-3 launching games into the AppStore's Top 25 Grossing ranks. We believe that innovative game design, commercial success, and making a difference all go hand in hand.
Our Marketing team is looking for a data hungry, performance UA manager. Someone that will fit in with their quirky and hard working style. Do you have what it takes?
RESPONSIBILITIES
Build, launch, analyze and optimize mobile app traffic campaigns, in order to maximize KPI goals.
Research and present new testing opportunities for active media buying channels and ASO.
Research and identify creative opportunities to share with the team, provide detailed analysis for best performing concepts for each channel.
Collaborate with design and content teams on production of new creatives.
Structure and launch creative and ASO A/B tests.
Monitor data integrity on a weekly basis and communicate any discrepancies back to Marketing analytics team.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in marketing or a quantitative discipline.
Strong entry-level or internship experience.
Proficient in excel and powerpoint.
Ability to troubleshoot data issues.
Ability to initiate, develop and maintain partnerships with other mobile and online companies.
Knowledge of mobile advertising campaign setup, optimization, and accounts management.
A passion for casual and mobile games!
POSITIVES
1+ year experience in digital marketing.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including strong writing and editing skills.
Familiarity with performance mobile marketing concepts like CPM, CPC, CTR, CVR, ROAS, LTV, etc.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and lead them through to implementation.
Ability to work under your own initiative.
MATERIALS REQUESTED
Cover letter indicating why you’re interested in the position
Current resume highlighting relevant and educational experience
Word or Gdoc outlining a mobile advertising creative idea for Choices.
Candidates without all of the above materials will not be considered.
Benefits
Good work/life balance. We are family-friendly and look at things in the long term.
High level of autonomy and freedom.
Work from home Tuesdays and Thursdays.
Full benefits package (PTO, 401k, Medical, Dental, Vision).
Easy commute (one block away from Mountain View CalTrain).

jd:
$49,248 - $61,164 a yearBulletin


An equal opportunity employer fostering a workforce that embraces and reflects
the rich diversity of Los Angeles County

Accounting Specialist

$3985 to $4948 Monthly

Insurance:
Your choice of several medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans

To learn more, visit:
https://www.lacoe.edu

Online applications
must be submitted by:

10/24/2018

5:00 P.M. (Pacific)
Retirement:
PERS Defined Benefit Plan

Paid Time Off:
12 days vacation. 14 holidays. 12 illness days.
The Los Angeles County Office of Education (LACOE) is recruiting for a conscientious and enthusiastic individual seeking employment in the area of clerical accounting. As an Accounting Specialist, you will perform a variety of specialized accounting functions in the maintenance, review, and reconciliation of financial records and accounts to ensure accuracy and compliance with established policies and procedures.

The Well Qualified Candidate Will Possess the Following

Knowledge:

Basic accounting principles, practices and procedures
Financial bookkeeping principles
Types of comprehensive government accounting reports
Applicable sections of State Education Code and other applicable laws
Use and application of automated accounting systems

Competencies:

Analyzing & Interpreting Data – Drawing meaning and conclusions from quantitative and/or qualitative data
Mathematical Facility – Performing computations and solving mathematical problems
Professional & Technical Expertise – Applying technical subject matter to the job
Using Technology – Working with electronic hardware and software applications
Action and Results Focus – Initiating tasks and focusing on accomplishment
Attention to Detail – Focusing on the details of work content, work steps, and final work products
Professional Integrity and Ethics – Displaying honesty, adherence to principles, and personal accountability
Self-Management – Showing personal organization, self-discipline, and dependability
Informing – Proactively obtaining and sharing information
Oral Communication – Engaging effectively in dialogue
Customer Focus – Attending to the needs and expectation of customers
Teamwork – Collaborating with others to achieve shared goals
Cultural Proficiency – Model communication and interaction that respect and include all individuals and their languages, abilities, religions, and cultures

Required Education and Experience

Education: Graduation from high school or equivalent with completion of 9 semester or 12 quarter units in college-level accounting courses from an institution of higher learning recognized by the Council of Higher Education Accreditation. Foreign degrees and credit units require translation and equivalency established by an agency recognized by the Commission on Teacher Credentialing.

Experience: Two years of experience in clerical accounting or bookkeeping.


Selection Process
Candidates who meet the minimum requirements above, will be invited to participate in an examination that may consist of a written examination, performance examination and structured interview.


Contact

For information about the examination process you may send an e-mail to
Jeff Henderson at henderson_jeffery@lacoe.edu

For general inquiries please call 562.803.8360 (Mon- Fri 8:00 am - 5:00 pm)

For complete application information, please go to https://www.lacoe.edu/PersonnelCommission.aspx

LACOE Personnel Commission, 9300 Imperial Hwy, EC-Annex, Downey, CA 90242

Additional Information
Minimum qualifications must be met by the close of filing date. For complete application information, please go to https://www.lacoe.edu/PersonnelCommission.aspx. For additional information on our selection procedures, please visit Exam Preparation on our website. Selection and promotion are based on a competitive examination process. Candidates who pass all exam parts are ranked according to overall exam score and placed on an eligibility (hiring) list. Vacant positions are filled from the top three ranks. Eligibility lasts for 12 months; however, additional recruitment may occur under a separate bulletin with additional candidates being merged onto the eligibility list. Some positions that involve public contact may require bilingual proficiency for which selective certification may apply (Education Code 45277.5). In addition, the eligibility list resulting from this examination may be used to fill vacancies in related job classifications for which no eligibility list exists (Education Code 45272). Veterans' Credit may be awarded for entry jobs.

Reasonable accommodations in completing an application and testing are available to individuals with disabilities. If you would like to request an accommodation, please call 562.803.8360 as early as possible.
This examination is authorized Dual Certification - Open to the Public and Promotional for LACOE employees.

Recruitment ID: 19-473

This announcement does not constitute an implied contract. Any part of this announcement is subject to change.

jd:
Company
The Wonderful Company LLC
The Role

The Resnick Family Office is seeking an Assistant Controller to join a team that is responsible for the accounting and reporting of the personal household spend of a multi-generational family. This is a hands-on role with a small team of three direct reports. You will also be interacting with and supported by a broader team of corporate professionals from business unit accounting, legal, treasury, tax, insurance, HR, and philanthropy groups. This is an amazing opportunity to support an incredibly successful and philanthropic family. This position is located in our West LA Corporate HQ. Please note that this role does not provide investment advice/analysis or manage any investments.

Here at The Wonderful Company, we hire talented, driven professionals that take pride in their work and celebrate a healthy lifestyle that represents our market-leading brands. The Assistant Controller is no exception. This person must be a highly motivated team player with excellent writing skills, communication skills and Excel skills with the ability to multi-task and remain organized in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Here's what you'll do:

Manage daily operations of the accounting team within the Resnick Family Office
Responsible for all aspects of the financial statements and tax packages for 26 individuals/trusts
Review all daily journal entries and all monthly, quarterly, and annual closing activities including general ledger maintenance and balance sheet reconciliations
Prepare monthly and quarterly financial reports for each family member
Financial planning and analysis for each of the individuals and trusts
Responsible for a credit card program (currently 34 cards) for family's personal staff
Oversee accounting for a portfolio of stock, private equity, and direct investments
Oversee bill payment schedule and coordinate wire transfers to fund accounts
Coordinate with Corporate Treasury to manage bank accounts and bank services
Lead, mentor, and develop three direct reports
Ad-hoc financial analysis projects
Focus on continuous improvement is important for everyone at this company
Typical work hours are 8:30 to 5:30, though flexibility is required
Reports to the Head of Family Office and has significant exposure to other executives
 Here's what you'll bring to the table:

CPA required. Strong knowledge of both cash basis accounting and GAAP matters
Minimum of five (5) years of total work experience, ideally with two (2) years of directly relevant work in a family office and two (2) years of public accounting
Superior problem solving and analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative)
Strong knowledge of Quickbooks and Microsoft Excel required, knowledge of Oracle a plus
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic, highly entrepreneurial environment
Bachelor Degree
Excellent accounting background and knowledge of accounting and finance compliance, month end closing, general ledger, budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision and ability to work effectively within a team
Unquestionable ethics
Incredible attention to detail and strong ability to organize
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Patience to work with high level people and adaptability to different types of personalities
Location
Los Angeles, CA
Perks
Here's what we'll bring to the table:
Competitive benefits packing including Medical, Vision, Dental, 401k
Subsidized gym membership
Onsite subsidized high end cafeteria offering farm to table meals and snacks
Free onsite yoga classes and other wellness-focused activities
Wonderful Giving (www.wonderfulgiving.com) - allowing you to donate company money to a cause of your choice
Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $4 billion global company dedicated to harvesting health and happiness around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company's 9,000 employees worldwide are committed to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, almonds, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company's market share: Wonderful Pistachios® is America's No. 1 tree nut brand and America's fastest-growing snack; Wonderful® Halos® is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI® Water is America's No. 1 premium imported bottled water brand; JUSTIN® Wine has the No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon in California; and Teleflora® is the world's leading floral delivery service. A recent Nielsen study evaluating the familiarity, quality, and momentum of more than 2,500 leading brands revealed that Wonderful Company products dominated the top 10 lists of consumers across all generations, more than any other consumer goods company.

The Wonderful Company's connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back in its DNA. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $200 million invested in environmental technologies and sustainability research, $45 million in charitable giving and education initiatives every year, $80 million toward the construction of a new charter school campus in California's Central Valley, and innovative health and wellness programs, including two new, free primary care clinics for employees and their dependents.

To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and core values, visit www.wonderful.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

The Wonderful Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and with opportunities for advancement. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories.

#LI-JS1

IND123

jd:
Reports To: Associate Director, Search & Social
Clients: The Walt Disney Studios, Disney Franchise

OMD Entertainment, an Omnicom Media Group agency, is seeking a coordinator level candidate for our Search & Social team to work on the Walt Disney Studios account. This is an exciting opportunity to work with this world class brand and stellar product from Pixar, DreamWorks, Marvel, and Lucasfilm.

OVERVIEW
The Coordinator, Search & Social is an individual contributor responsible for assisting the Search & Social Specialists with tactical work required to manage a given business segment. This is the entry level paid search and paid social position; therefore, it is primarily internal, not client facing. Core accountability includes tactical aspects of campaign planning & management, trafficking, daily optimization, building reports, & responding to ad hoc requests from team leadership. Search & Social Coordinators will participate in search and social planning and strategy sessions in order to prepare them for advancement to the Search & Social Specialist role.
SEARCH KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform day-to-day campaign activities for paid search (PPC) campaigns on Google/Bing/YouTube and become seasoned in search management platforms: Google AdWords, Bing Ads Editor, & DoubleClick Search
Manage campaign activity, traffic ads, and monitor performance on a daily basis
Implement optimizations and analysis of campaigns
Create Reporting and Ad Hoc Data Pulls
Manage billing and Insertion Orders for all search campaigns
Contribute to search strategy and overall plan
Pull Competitive Analysis & Insights
SOCIAL KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Utilize social management tools (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat) to set up ads and targeting for execution
Pull audience reports and analyze and report findings to Social Media team
Assist in the creation of weekly and one-off reporting
Work with Social Specialists to ensure proper execution of all Social Media campaigns
Compile and file campaign screenshots
QA the data for campaign reports
Send, Request and file all insertion orders for a campaign and work with billing coordinator to ensure accuracy
Manage the input of campaign accounting information into established systems



REQUIREMENTS
BA / BS Required – Marketing Degree, Business Degree desired.
Online marketing experience desired, paid social and search engine marketing a strong plus.
Required competency in the following areas:
Basic understanding of online marketing including SEM, SEO, display, & paid social
Demonstrated strong work ethic, time management skills, and ability to multi-task. Self-starter able to deal with ambiguity.
Analytical mindset. Strong problem solving skills that balance quantitative and qualitative thinking. Familiarity with Excel a plus.
Strong organizational skills
Excellent communicator, able to explain complex concepts clearly.
Proven team player.
Excel and Word familiarity required; PowerPoint familiarity a plus.

What is your purpose?
We believe in building places that matter.

With everything we do, we believe in doing the right thing.

The way we do this is to solve complex constructability challenges.

We just happen to build iconic buildings.

Want to help build our team?

Can you
Flexibly and effectively cope with change
Encourage collaboration and problem-solving in high-stakes situations
Clearly represent all information with expediency and transparency
Self-motivate to learn, investigate and understand
Commit to doing what the job requires to be done right
Do you have
A bachelor’s degree in human resources, organizational behavior, business or other applicable field
A proven track record recruiting experienced talent in specialized, technical and hard to fill roles
Prior experience recruiting talent in the construction industry (highly desirable)
Proficiency with Applicant Tracking Systems
Prior experience implementing Applicant Tracking Systems (highly desirable)
Proficiency using, job boards and LinkedIn to source active and passive candidates
Proficiency with Microsoft Office
A proven track record of building collaborative relationships with hiring managers
A demonstrated ability to create strategic sourcing plans to attract high caliber talent
The Role
Your key responsibilities will include:

Leading MATT Construction’s recruitment efforts and providing full-lifecycle recruiting, hiring and onboarding support
Collaborating with HR director, marketing, and executive leadership to create high impact recruiting strategies and solutions
Collaborating with executives and hiring managers to identify needs and develop recruiting strategies for multiple open positions at entry-, mid-, and senior-levels in all areas of project management, supervision and administration
Developing and maintaining relationships with hiring managers: discussing hiring needs and required skill sets to get a solid understanding of the position, team dynamic and culture
Working with leadership to develop job descriptions: defining the scopes, skills, competencies and critical success factors that support the organization’s recruiting, succession and development plans
Overseeing the creation and placement of all job postings
Maintaining social media employment strategy: using LinkedIn and Facebook to assist in recruitment efforts and drive traffic to MATT’s career website
Successfully sourcing and recruiting candidates via event and social media networking, referrals, job boards and Boolean searches
Developing networks in the industry to identify and source high potential talent
Establishing and coordinating relationships with organizations, universities and community and technical colleges
Coordinating and attending career fairs
Managing robust employee referral program
Managing the ATS to track candidate application process
Researching new methods of conducting the recruiting, interviewing and hiring process
Facilitating the development, presentation and negotiation of offers
Conducting total rewards benchmarking to ensure MATT’s offerings are competitive
New employee onboarding
Establishing quantitative and qualitative metrics to evaluate activity effectiveness and ROI
To apply for this position, please click here.

company: UCP of Los Angeles, Ventura and Santa Barbara Counties
jd:
Overview
UCP Wheels for Humanity, a subsidiary of United Cerebral Palsy of Los Angeles, Ventura & Santa Barbara Counties (UCPLA), was founded in 1996. Our mission is to promote greater inclusion for people with disabilities globally – through mobility, therapy, advocacy, and empowerment.

We are seeking an experienced, driven, and goal-oriented Director of Development who will be responsible for the strategic planning, management, and implementation of the organization’s fund development efforts. The ideal candidate will be adept at creating and implementing plans to achieve long-term goals, while also balancing the day-to-day needs of the organization.
Responsibilities
Achieve an annual fundraising goal of approximately $1 million through major gifts, foundation and corporate support, special events, direct mail, and website/email/social media campaigns
Forge and maintain relationships and strategies to build the organization’s visibility, impact, and financial resources
Work with the senior management team on the creation of the organization’s strategic plan, and develop short- and long-term goals for securing resources to carry out the plan
Develop and execute a well-designed stewardship plan for various donor levels
Create a corporate and foundation grants strategy and oversee its execution
Lead the annual fundraising event planning committee and manage the execution of the organization’s signature event
Support the creation of key messages and develop communications plans to increase the organization’s visibility
Work with the Marketing Manager to create all organizational materials and publications including solicitation campaigns and letters, brochures and newsletters, press releases, event-related materials, web and social media content
Regularly provide verbal, written, quantitative, and qualitative fund development and communications analyses, briefings, and recommendations to the Executive Director and Board of Directors
Develop and manage a productive team of two full-time staff, and provide guidance to staff throughout the organization on issues related to external relations
Manage the implementation of Bloomerang and oversee staff responsible for data entry and gift processing
Develop and manage the annual budget for all outreach, communications, and fundraising expenses
Qualifications
6-10 years of professional experience in nonprofit fundraising
2-5 years of experience supervising staff
Knowledge in several aspects of fund development, including grant writing, event planning, direct mail, corporate engagement, and donor relations
Experience developing and maintaining productive working relationships with board members, donors, and foundations
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Ability to work as a leader and as part of a team
Ability to work some evenings and weekends to meet deadlines, attend functions, or participate in meetings
Donor database management experience
Bilingual in English and Spanish (a plus)
BA (required), MA (a plus)

We offer competitive compensation commensurate with experience, medical and dental insurance, paid holidays, vacation benefits, paid sick leave, and 403(b) retirement.

UCP Wheels for Humanity is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates. UCP Wheels also considers qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment pursuant to California Law and, if applicable, the L.A. Fair Chance Ordinance.
